name: Make sure that you do not use Web SQL databases
Ensure you don't use jQuery $.cookie because it is deprecated
Ensure you use Ajax method with dataType with jQuery version older than 3.0.0
Ensure you use dialog with closeText parameter with jQuery UI version older than 1.12
Ensure you don't use html() with jQuery 1.9.0 (or older)
Ensure you don't use $(location.hash) with jQuery version older than 1.6.3
Ensure you don't use .append() after() with jQuery 1.4.2 (or older)
Ensure you don't use attr() with jQuery 3.0.0-rc1
Ensure you don't use Dialog widget from jQuery UI with version older than 1.10.0
Ensure you don't use Tooltip widget from jQuery UI with version older than 1.10.0
Ensure you don't use TLS library from NodeJS with version older than 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use HTTP/2 llibrary from  NodeJS with version older than 6.14.13, 8.11.3, 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use normalizeStringWin32 method of Path module with Node.js 8.5.0
Ensure you don't reference Buffer.fill() or Buffer.alloc() with some parameters  of NodeJS versions older than 6.14.3, 8.11.3, 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use Buffer with UC2 encoding from NodeJS with version older than 6.14.4, 8.11.4 and 10.9.0
Ensure you don't reference url.parse wich using javascript protocol with NodeJS  version older than 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0
Ensure you don't use the path module from NodeJS with version older than 4.9.0
Ensure you don't use 'ps' package' methods from NodeJS with version older than 1.0.0
Ensure you don't reference net.createConnection method of net.Socket service with NodeJS  version older than 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use third-party module query-mysql versions 0.0.0, 0.0.1, and 0.0.2  from NodeJS
Ensure you no longer us Buffer() function or new Buffer() constructor because they are deprecated
Ensure you don't unserialize data using node-serialize package version 0.0.4
Ensure you don't deserialize data using node-serialize package version 0.5.0
Ensure you don't use moment before 2.19.3 functions
Ensure you don't reference url.parse wich using javascript protocol with NodeJS  version older than 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0
Ensure you don't use TLS library from NodeJS with version older than 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use normalizeStringWin32 method of Path module with Node.js 8.5.0
Ensure you don't use the path module from NodeJS with version older than 4.9.0
Ensure you don't use HTTP/2 llibrary from  NodeJS with version older than 6.14.13, 8.11.3, 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't reference Buffer.fill() or Buffer.alloc() of NodeJS versions older than 6.14.3, 8.11.3, 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use Buffer with UC2 encoding from NodeJS with version older than 6.14.4, 8.11.4 and 10.9.0
Ensure you don't use third-party module query-mysql versions with NodeJS
Ensure you don't reference net.createConnection method of net.Socket service with NodeJS versions from 9.7.0 to  9.11.2 and from 10.0.0 to 10.4.1
Change access modifier to "private", "internal"or "private protected"
Use XmlReader instead of XmlTextReader since it is deprecated and may lead to security issues
BannedAPI should not be used because they are considered deprecated and unsafe
Ensure excluding class parameter for ParametersInterceptor when using Struts 2.3.16 (and older)
Ensure not using wildcard for cookiesName param configuration in CookieInterceptor with Struts 2.3.16 (and Older). This allow preventing Injection attack.
Ensure note using wildcards for action mapping name to avoid executing arbitrary Java code on server side
configured without namespace or with wildcard namespace is vulnerable to remote code execution attack
Ensure not using excludeParams for Struts 2.3.20 ( and older) to avoid
Prefer using short request parameter name to prevent the DOS attack
Ensure you are using Struts URLValidator with at least version 2.5.13 or 2.3.34
Using invoking dataHandler.createXStream method with type filtering to Remote Code Execution when deserializing XML payloads
Using Dynamic Method Invocation for Apache Struts 2.x allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via method: prefix, related to chained expressions.
Ensure you have upgraded your Struts framework 2.3.24.1 and above if you use special top object
Ensure not using JSON-lib library for Rest Plugin of Struts 2.5 to 2.5.14
Avoid artifacts having db.collection.ensureIndex() to create new indexes
